definitions.definition: Pertaining to or dependent on circumstances , especially as opposed to essentials ; incidental , not essential.
Involving evidence that relies on inference to connect it to a conclusion of fact , thus, suggesting guilt but not directly proving it.
examples: It is unlikely he will be convicted; the evidence against him is circumstantial at best.

definitions.definition: Abounding with minor circumstances; in great detail ; particular .
Full of circumstance or pomp ; ceremonial .

main_definition: Pertaining to or dependent on circumstances , especially as opposed to essentials ; incidental , not essential.

Abounding with minor circumstances; in great detail ; particular .
Full of circumstance or pomp ; ceremonial .
